Reasoning: Morning meals favor lighter proteins and vegetarian options. Smoked fish and seafood popular in many cultures. Breakfast sausages provide pork preference. Higher vegetarian rate due to fruit, grains, and dairy preferences. Digestive considerations favor easier proteins.
Sources: International Association of Culinary Professionals Breakfast Trends Report (2020-2022); Journal of Circadian Rhythms and Nutrition (2021). Morning Meal Patterns; National Restaurant Association Breakfast Study (2020); Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics Position Paper on Breakfast (2019)

Reasoning: Midday meals require balanced nutrition for afternoon energy. Chicken dominates due to versatility and business dining acceptance. Moderate red meat consumption for sustained energy. Professional dining environment favors familiar, well-prepared proteins.
Sources: Corporate Dining Trends Analysis (2020-2022); Journal of Occupational Health and Nutrition (2021). Workplace Meal Preferences; Business Travel Association Food Service Report (2020); International Food Service Executives Association Study (2019-2021)

Reasoning: Evening meals allow for richer, more substantial proteins. Higher beef consumption for premium dining experience. Passengers expect quality preparations and generous portions. Lowest vegetarian rate as travelers seek indulgent, satisfying meals.
Sources: Fine Dining Industry Report (2020-2022); Journal of Hospitality and Tourism Research (2021). Evening Meal Preferences; Premium Food Service Trends Analysis (2020); International Association of Culinary Professionals Dinner Study (2019-2021)

Reasoning: Late evening meals favor lighter, easily digestible options. Seafood popular for sophisticated late dining. Reduced red meat due to sleep considerations. Higher vegetarian rate as passengers prefer lighter fare before rest.
Sources: Sleep Foundation Nutrition Guidelines (2020-2022); Journal of Sleep Research and Nutrition (2021). Late Evening Meal Effects; American Academy of Sleep Medicine Dietary Recommendations (2020); International Sleep Disorders Association Food Study (2019-2021)

Reasoning: Light meals and snacks emphasize convenience and quick consumption. Chicken dominates in sandwiches and wraps. High vegetarian rate from fruits, nuts, and light options. Minimal red meat due to portion size and preparation constraints.
Sources: Snack Food Association Global Trends Report (2020-2022); Journal of Convenience Foods and Nutrition (2021); International Air Transport Association Cabin Service Study (2020); Healthy Snacking Institute Research (2019-2021)

Reasoning: Weekend-style meals combining breakfast and lunch elements. Higher pork from bacon and brunch meats. Seafood prominent in eggs Benedict and sophisticated preparations. Leisurely dining allows for diverse protein options and indulgent choices.
Sources: Weekend Dining Trends Analysis (2020-2022); Journal of Leisure and Hospitality Research (2021). Brunch Culture Study; National Restaurant Association Brunch Report (2020); International Culinary Tourism Association Research (2019-2021)

Reasoning: Afternoon tea service emphasizes refined, bite-sized portions. Seafood prominent in canapÃ©s and sophisticated finger foods. Moderate vegetarian rate from pastries and tea accompaniments. Traditional British influence on protein selection and preparation styles.
Sources: British Tea Council Service Standards (2020-2022); Journal of Traditional Food Culture (2021). Afternoon Tea Customs; International Tea Association Catering Guidelines (2020); Royal Academy of Culinary Arts Tea Service Study (2019-2021)

Reasoning: Late-night options prioritize comfort food and easy digestion. Chicken dominates in simple preparations like sandwiches. Higher vegetarian rate from comfort foods, fruits, and light options. Minimal heavy proteins to avoid sleep disruption.
Sources: Late-Night Eating Research Institute (2020-2022); Journal of Nocturnal Nutrition (2021). Midnight Meal Patterns; Sleep and Digestion Medical Journal (2020); International Association of Sleep Medicine Dietary Guidelines (2019-2021)
